captions.text:
Hi everyone, it's Karena and Katrina from
toneitup.com and we are on Livestrong Woman.

Today, we're doing our Tone It Up Arm Routine
and using our Fine Toning method. Now, we

recommend doing this routine two to three
times per week. And this is follow along style,

so you have your printable routine at the
link below. And let's get started. You guys

ready? Alright, we're going to start with
Curls. Now, we're doing five arm moves and

we're adding some of that Tone It Up Cinching
in there. And then we're going to repeat each

set three times all the through. So just follow
along with us and have some fun with it. And

two more here. And then come halfway up and
hold, just small, tiny little movements. And

remember, you can use weights at whatever
weight that you want. So if you wanna start

with 8s or 10s and then drop it down, you
can. Alright, now, let's bring them overhead

and extend -- reach for the sky. Abs are tight
and engaged the entire time. And two more.

And then follow along here: Slight little
cinching forward, bringing the elbows in front,

and reverse. Alright, bring the dumbbells
down, turn to your side, bend foreword at

your hips: We're going to do Rear Flys for
ten. This creates that nice definition in

the back for the shoulders into the triceps.
You definitely don't wanna neglect those back

muscles. A lot of us just do push-ups and
dips all day. Good. And two. Last one, let's

hold it up and cinch. Whew, alright, and bring
your weights down. Now bring your arms at

90 degrees and we're gonna work those triceps.
So extend and really engage your triceps.

Think about hinging at the elbows. So you're
upper arm stays in one line and you're just

moving those forearms back. And the last one.
And we're holding for ten -- 9, 8. Feel it?

And 5, 4, 3, 2, 1. Whew, alright, we can stand
back up. And now we are doing an Upright Row.

So row, bring those weights up, palms are
facing your body. This is one of our favorite

moves to really sculpt the outside of the
shoulders and nice definition. Yes. Make sure

you're wrists are neutral. You don't wanna
be like this, like a little kangaroo or anything.

Alright, we're gonna add that fine toning:
Arms are up and slow, slow little motions

down. And we'll bring it up, and slow little
motions down. And one more time. Bring it

up, and slow. Whew, alright, that was great.
That was round one. Let's just stretch out

our arms a little bit if you like there. Can
I do it with my weights? Yes. Alright, back

into those bicep curls. Let's go. Now, during
this entire workout, we are doing that cinching,

which is part of the Fine Toning method. And
what that is: We have long range of motion,

and then we combine it with that cinching,
which we'll start right now. And that small,

little isometric moves that really fine tone
your muscles. Alright, ready to bring those

weights overhead and press. Breathing back
there? Yes. Good. And two more. And let's

cinch it forward and bring it back. Alright,
ready for those Rear Flys again? Yep. Bend

forward at your waist. Arms hanging down and
squeeze. Squeeze your shoulder blades. Make

sure your abs are in too, your core is tight.
Alright, round three. Whew, high five on that

one. Yay. My arms are feeling it. Yeah, so
remember, you can do that two to three times

per week along with the other full-body toning
or ab routine. Leave a comment below with

what you wanna see next time. Don't forget
to subscribe to Livestrong Woman. And we'll
see you soon, bye.

title: Fine Toning Arm Routine | Tone It Up Tuesdays
